page.title: 02Historical Development(cont)
page.content: Sidmouth's narrow valley setting has greatly influenced its growth. The small historic settlements at{Sidford and{Sidbury}are now almost continuous of the main settlement, since growth has occurred along the main valley floor of the Sid. Sidmouth and its adjoining settlements in the Sid Valley have an outstanding heritage of historic buildings. There are 484 buildings now listed as of special architectural and historic interest in the area. Most are on the statutory list and only 55 are recorded as of merely local interest. A measure of the significance of Sidmouth's historic buildings is that as many as 22 buildings are noted as worthy of Grade II status; these are buildings of particular importance.
